body_html: @colesbury I don't see why AT_CUDA_ENABLED can't be used in public headers, if inlining is needed. It's defned in a configure generated header which we install in users, so it will work correctly in any situation. What we're not supposed to do is change the API depending on if you compiled with CUDA or not, but that's not what's going on here.

body: @colesbury I don't see why `AT_CUDA_ENABLED` can't be used in public headers, if inlining is needed. It's defned in a configure generated header which we install in users, so it will work correctly in any situation. What we're not supposed to do is change the API depending on if you compiled with CUDA or not, but that's not what's going on here.
